Reviews.Title: “a good no thrills hotel”
Reviews.Author: issybb
Reviews.Content: stayed here with my sig other and daughter in april 07, sorry its late ! basic comfortable room, excellent breakfast and coffee. good pool and jacuzzi outside, about ten mins from town, very friendly helpfull staff. recommended

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a short stay in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: pigletpink
Reviews.Content: Having read some of the reviews on Tripadvisor, I was slightly concerned about staying at the Kings Copthorne. However, the negative reviews proved to be misguided as our stay here was excellent. The staff were ALL extremely friendly and helpful, particularly at check in, when we had to wait for our room to be ready after a very long flight from the UK. However, we were offered bottles of water and a quiet seat in the business centre whilst our room was prepared. The staff could not have been more helpful. The room was a standard twin room - perfectly clean, well maintained and serviced every day. The bathroom was also very clean, with towels changed daily. The slight disappointment was the water pressure in the shower - a minor concern! Food in the 'StarsCafe' was excellent and very good value, considering Singapore is known to be expensive. Location good - hop on/off tour bus stopped right outside the hotel The one disappointment was breakfast - again, expensive and catered mainly for Asian tastes (as you would expect), but eggs, cereal, fruit and toast available. All in all, I would not hesitate to stay here again - great hotel !

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: suzeb46
Reviews.Content: good room and bathroom, flatscreen tv. Not on river, but not too far away. Staff friendy and helpful. Breakfast fine. Clean comfortabe room, able to relax there. Hotel has a nice pool and jacuzzi, not too many people using it and it was quiet and relaxing. hotel has a golf 'course' didnt use that. Enjoyed a short stay here, and was comfortable. Bit pricey!

Reviews.Title: “buiz hotel”
Reviews.Author: anujaustin
Reviews.Content: Pure buiz hotel, In Sin they have a very diff style of behavior, Lets just believe that they are not rude but its there nature. Always select rooms on the center wing, they are new, right wing is old and is due for renovation.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel,nice pool but more for transit.”
Reviews.Author: flossyPembrokeshire
Reviews.Content: We s tayed here for 1night/2days post cruise.We arrived mid morning-very efficient friendly reception staff but when we were taken to our room it had not been vacated by previous customers, so back down 18 floors to reception! We were re allocated a room on the 8th floor. Room was fine/clean but the bathroom was a bit tired! The hotel may not be bang in the middle of the touristy area but this is made up by the fact that the hotel runs a free shuttle on the hour every hour from 10.00am-8.00pm which stops at 4 popular areas of the city.If you are too late for the last shuttle back-it only costs a few £s back.The breakfast was good and there is a little cafe/bistro restaurant near reception which is reasonable in price and food is good.We were able to extend our room till 2pm at no extra charge and then were directed to the 3rd floor where we had full use of the pool/spa facilities and showers/changing rooms as our flight was not till 10.50pm-this was a loveley little area to relax and sunbathe. The hotel is having some work done updating the rooms-we had a peak and the new ones looked wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: UKandmore
Reviews.Content: Booked into double room, was given twin. Room was "upgrade" to a suite! Suite outside the AC engines (not too quiet). Buffett was okay. Coffee was disgusting, any additional teas (green/ ginger etc) available at cost. Location a little further out than what we hoped. Food tasted cheap & not so fresh.

Reviews.Title: “Good Price, Good Service but no Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: lcfb
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 nights in this hotel, I was upgraded upon arrival for no apparent reason and was told I was given a room with a balcony. In fact the room was overlooking the back of the hotel and the balcony was minuscule. The room was of good size and clean but the bathroom was not very clean at all with a shower curtain which was full of stain. Staff were very helpful and always smiling and the price was good so I cannot really complain. Internet is S$20 per day but I did not use it. I did not try the food nor the bars and restaurants. In fact the hotel reception is rather attractive but the room are a bit old and run down especially the bathrooms. The hotel is within walking distance of Clarke Quay.

Reviews.Title: “CONFORTABLE STAY, VERY WELL LOCATED”
Reviews.Author: Comando23
Reviews.Content: Very well located, near the river´s restaurants and bars (across the avenue). The HIP HOP bus stops at one block from the hotel. Good room service, kind attention; all very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Oh Dear....”
Reviews.Author: said2151
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 days in Jan 2012 and again in early Feb 2012. The first visit was ok, but the second was appalling. How this place got 4 stars is a mystery...2 stars would be more appropriate. Rooms fairly clean, average size, individual aircon which was not adequate. Daily room service. Vacuum cleaners are banned at this hotel, it would seem. For those with children be advised some of the exterior windows are not secure and can be pushed open easily. I noted also an absence of smoke detectors in the rooms. This hotels single biggest failing is the appalling customer service. Our aircon became so noisy I thought it was a fire bell going off. We had to demand a room change, never suggested and no apology. Requests for extra towels or clean cups were simply ignored. Use another hotel, not this one.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Tattmeister
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in January in the tower wing - the rooms were small but nicely set up. Whilst clean the curtains were dirty in room 519 and the thermostat required fixing. Breakfast was included and was adequate - the complimentary shuttle was good - but you must register. We enjoyed the pool. The downside was check in took 30 minutes and our second room was not ready although after 2pm. On the plus side we received a small new years gift - a nice touch and we were an able to use the Pool area and showers on the day we left. Overall pretty good but not the best choice for families as no connecting rooms.

Reviews.Title: “good location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: BK_Shanghai
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for just two nights on a business trip. Early check in was possible free of charge. But no one from the service was able to iron my suite.. Anyway, they provided the iron at least. The room was clean but really small. But the view and the small balcony were compensating. Location is pretty good. You can walk to Clarke Quai, plenty of restaurants around there. Facilities are nice and in good shape. Breakfast was good as well, wide range of Asian and Western

Reviews.Title: “Surpassed our expectation”
Reviews.Author: chiachiang
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights at a deluxe room over the weekend, was given a family room on the 5th floor. Check in was prompt, the hotel lobby seems quiet on a Saturday afternoon. Room was clean and spacious, and have a balcony for some fresh air. Breakfast is decent and ends at late 1030am. Swimming pool is small but it is sufficient on a low season month. Same for the gym, sauna, jaccuzzi. What we loved most is the location of the hotel, which is minutes away from Robertson quay. We enjoyed the evening walk along the Singapore river. Endless cafes, restaurants line the sides of the river leading to the Marina barrage.

Reviews.Title: “Typical 4* hotel”
Reviews.Author: StueyD
Reviews.Content: Pretty good location, fairly typical 4* hotel I feel. Service attentive. Only fault would be the musty smelling rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Service needs to be improved”
Reviews.Author: NandiniHyderabad
Reviews.Content: Inspite of advance booking thru their website and showing the confirmation mail, the front office made us wait for more than half hr at the reception before they allotted rooms to us.we had a booking for 5 rooms but got only2 rooms on arrival, other 3 were allotted only by eve, inspite of the delay they didn't even have the courtesy to allow us late check out or some other way of saying sorry. At the coffee shop , while my mother was still eating in a plate , the waitress almost pulled her plate off, this just doesn't happen in hospitality industry.i am not at all happy with the hotel. The service was pathetic , the staff was not at all friendly .very very unhappy to choose this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Last Minute”
Reviews.Author: StoreKeepers12
Reviews.Content: Okay I was a business trip to Singapore. My company did a last mintue reservation as they scrambled for a hotel room. I never heard about this hotel, ask my driver about it. He gave me a so, so look. When I arrived it was nice on the outside, staff was friendly, and place look okay. Got my room, and notice the floor had not been vaccummed, stains on the carpet, not the cleaniest place I stayed. Bed was hard a rock room was smaller than it looks on any of their pictures (website). AND THIS WAS AN UPGRADE! Due to they overbooked! For the price I wouldn't recommend, I was glad this was a short stay! Oh and there were fruit flies buzz around in the room they I had to kill.

Reviews.Title: “Singapore Family Vacation - 3rd week Oct 2011”
Reviews.Author: kaushikchatt
Reviews.Content: Hi – This was our first trip to Singapore, and we had booked our hotel which had a check-in time from 14.00 hours, however we were not aware that it was going to be a real pain getting a room allocated to us before time. We had to wait for about 3 hours in the hotel lobby while they got the rooms ready for us (Make sure you sync your arrival and hotel check in time within 2-3 hours from landing and hotel check-in) . There is a very nice breakfast joint across the street a little expensive but excellent quality food a must try (We spent 1 off the 3 hours here). The hotel & rooms have a very modern look and feel to it, the rooms though very small have a very comfortable and cousy bed, but the bathing tub is really small and a squeeze fit, if you want to enjoy the tub facility (not really recommended). The breakfast is a standard one as you will find in all hotels of today. The staff was very warm and helpful. They provided us a MAP of Singapore and how to find our way around. The hotel is very well located to get a cab and even a bus which is just a mins. walk from the hotel front porch. If you are not dinning in the hotel food choice is very limited unless you are into the local cuisines, not too much choice for multi-cuisine restaurants in the area. I would come back to this hotel as it was value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and still top business option”
Reviews.Author: mosquita
Reviews.Content: This is my second review of CK, prompted by some odd comments by other travellers. I have stayed at the CK every two month for a couple of years, and I honestly don't recognise some of the complaints, but here's my penny's worth: 1. IMPORTANT: the difference between the rooms in the tower and in the main building (I think these are called deluxe) is massive. The rooms in the main building all have balconies, and are of a MUCH higher standard. So ensure you always book these. It is correct that the rooms can be noisy due to traffic, but not overwhelmingly so (and I am very fussy about this). 2. Check-in/out can be very slow. But I have always found staff to be courteous and helpful, and trying to accommodate special requests. 3. Bad, stale coffee? Cannot be. Coffees for breakfast are freshly brewed from an espresso machine. Otherwise, yes, breakfast could be better, but for an Asian palate it is actually very good, and plenty of options, egg station etc for the rest of us, too 4. Poor location? What? Just across the street from Singapore's coolest al fresco restaurant area Robertson's Quay. Much nicer, with much larger choice than any other area, and added bonus for solo travellers, as it isn't rowdy, and a great spot for people-watching. And 10 minutes walk from Chinatown, 5 mins from Great world City, a large shopping mall. OK, if you're into Orchard Road, you need a taxi, but not exactly a big hassle. Overall, I wouldn't swap CK for anything. Would like to see more soundproofing and improvements in speed at registration, but otherwise I think this is the best biz hotel in Singapore for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, good location”
Reviews.Author: Alex182
Reviews.Content: Hotel was nice, clean, room also clean. Good view from my window. Good location, near city. I recomend. Could be cheaper, but...hmm. Registration could be faster.

Reviews.Title: “Did the job...”
Reviews.Author: Samiantha
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of our honeymoon as a stop over on route to Bali and stayed for 3 nights. We wanted a base, somewhere to sleep and this served its purpose. When we booked we had the option of bed and breakfast but on reviewing the price we decided that it wasn't worth it as we had researched that plenty of coffee shops offered similar breakfasts at the fraction of the price. Our tour operator had informed them that we were on our honeymoon, arriving on the early flight we got to the hotel just after 8am. We thought being on our honeymoon they may have offered us an early checkin as a good will gesture. Checkin is normally 2pm. They could offer us our room but at a price for 70Sing Dollars excl. tax. Having established that we could keep our suitcases etc there we decided to decline to which then they informed us we could check in at 12mid-day. From research we found out that there was a bus stop near the hotel next door (Miramir). Here two hop-on-hop off buses stoped (at about 20 sing dollars), and the singapore airlines hop on hop off bus stopped (6 sing dollars if you flew with them - remember your boarding pass). At this bus stop the Singapore Zoo bus also stopped at 4 sing dollars each way, with this stop being the last stop (visit Singapore tourist informaiton for more details). The hotel is only about a 10minute walk to Chinatown and Clarke Quay so has good links to the city. Ignore the distances on the map as we were able (with a drink stop off :-) ) to walk from the Marina Bay Sands back to the hotel. The room was clean but though is was a non smoking room is still had a slight smell of smoke (could do with the curtains being washed as this was where I found the smoke to be coming from). Bed was comfy and did the job for sleep. We didn't spend much time at the hotel, literally just to sleep. We did not use the pool as we didn't have time but it looked clean and was a nice option to have. We did not eat or have any drinks here having established that Clarke Quay was only a short walk away. We would go to Singapore again, but with the vast offer of hotels in the area probably would only stay here if it was on a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Stop over in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: normans28
Reviews.Content: For the past six years have used the Orchard Hotel, Orchard Road and the Grand Copthorne Watherfront. As the cost of staying in Singapore on transit between London and Brisbane and vice versa is becoming silly we decided to try a four start hotel. Did not expect the same standard as the other two and was not disapointed. Small but very clean rooms. Very noisy live group in a small bar. The major failing is that they do not cater for the western appetite and the meals and drinks are very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid if you can!”
Reviews.Author: JazC14
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on the last night of our honeymoon on the way back to the UK, and what a terrible way to end what had been until then, been an amazing trip! The service at check in was poor at best and when we explained we were on our honeymoon (which we were told would give us a room upgrade), we were thrilled when they gave us a room on the top floor. Thinking this would be a beautiful room we walked into a tiny, cramped, smoking room where we couldn't even open the windows to get fresh air! When I called reception, they kept on cutting me off and told me they would call me back. Twenty mins later we still had not heard anything so my husband had to go back to reception where he finally got the issue resolved and we were given a new room. After a terrible welcome we could not wait to get out of there! Although our new room was a lot more spacious, the bathroom was very outdated and overall cleanliness wasn't great. I hope our experience is just a one-off and given that the hotel was so busy it was obviously doing something right, however with so many quality hotels in Singapore I would try to avoid this one!

Reviews.Title: “Helpful & friendly staff but noisy location hotel has come into the years”
Reviews.Author: KH3216
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights for a stop-over at the hotel in October 2011. We picked it based on our previous good experience at Copthorne Orchid Singapore, which is now being redeveloped as a residential complex. The strong point is the generally very helful and responsive staff. For example, they followed up on a noise complaint due to party goers right away. If one needs a quiet location, this is definitely not the place to go. A busy road to the front and a noisy ventilation shaft at the back. With single glazing windows the sound of traffic is permanent. Stayed at a regular room in the lower floors first (quite old installations, stained carpets, no shower hose), but then upgraded to one of the club rooms above. This was a bit better but probably did not justify the healthy upgrade charge. Nice swimming pool, exercise room and sauna. In conclusion, just good for business and a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Okay for a short stopover”
Reviews.Author: JacDer
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over the F1 weekend. We arrived around 8am and were charged around £45 for an early check-in which was ridiculous considering the room was already available. Room was very small and to be frank, not very clean i.e. stained pillowcases, dirty glasses in bathroom. On the plus side the staff were extremely helpful, the outdoor space is nice with a small swimming pool. It is certainly not a 4* hotel by anyone's standards. Overall very disappointed considering the high price we paid for it due to GP weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough for us!”
Reviews.Author: travelbaguk4
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 3 nights at the CK, We have visited Singapore several times and were aware it was a little bit outside the main areas however would not recommend the location for first time visiters as there is no MRT within walking distence and the hotel shuttle is very limited. As we had travelled by Singapore Airlines we were able to use our boarding cards to travel at half price $6 each for a whole day) on the SIA HOHO bus which stops directly outside the hotel. We were happy to ride the circuit for 2 out of the 3 days we were there - it gave us our bearings and gave clear detail about each stop. You do have to look closely at the bus stop signs though as the SIA badge is quite small Back to the hotel review - we arrived around 9am and our room was available on the 10th floor with a great view over to the river and the busy Havelock Road The room was to the right of the elevator shaft so no noise from people coming and going. it was a fair size with a large comfortable bed and large bathroom with shower over the bath and a pull out washing line! Shower gel and soap in large dispensers so nothing fancy but perfectly adequate. There was a fridge with tea coffee making facilities etc Have to say the powdered coffee was foul so bought a jar of our own and some fresh milk! We had breakfast included in our charge so gave it a go - but it was very poor in quality and freshness and the coffee was stewed . Perversly it improved day by day ! So by the last day it was perfectly acceptable but the coffee was still foul! We were out all day so didnt eat at the hotel . We used taxis which are cheap and plentiful and walked back one evening from Clarke Quay along the river which only took 20 mins. Maybe a bit hot in the day time but a lovely after dinner walk at night. We were being picked up at 2pm for the airport and the front desk said check out was 2pm - so that gave us a whole morning to enjoy Singapore with time to shower and change before pick up instead of having to pack up and hang about. The staff were all as helpful and smiley as could be and nothing was too much trouble. All in all we hadnt paid a great deal for the stay and expected far worse than what we got - Singapore is not a place to spend time in a hotel and all you need is somewhere safe,comfortable and clean and CK was all those things .

Reviews.Title: “Poor "luxury" room & wasn't ready for 7pm arrival”
Reviews.Author: Jay77-02
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at 7pm in the evening, we were told that a room was not ready for us, so were asked to wait in the Business Centre when one was made up for us, which would take about 20 minutes. We were allowed to use the internet & given some water when we waited, and also told that we had been upgraded to a “luxury” room due to the inconvenience. After 45 minutes, our room was finally ready (Room 302), but I would not call it a luxury room. It was tucked at the end of the corridor and because you had extra corridor outside for access into the Tower, the room itself was tiny – there was barely enough space to walk around the bed. The room also had stains down the bathroom door and on the carpet, but as we were only there for three nights, and exhausted after travelling, we just put up with it. I would say that the room was more like a courtesy room used for late check-outs, which could explain why it had not been cleaned when we arrived. We had previously stayed in Hong Kong & Bali on this trip, and their basic rooms were far more luxurious than this "upgaded" one. When I inspected the mini bar, I noticed that there was a half drank bottle of juice in there, and other items on the inventory were missing, so reported these, which were rectified quite fast. The pool area is very nice – we used this first thing on a morning and were the only ones in the pool. Also has a Jacuzzi with nice wooden surround. Changing facilities were very basic though. We didn’t eat in the hotel, so not sure what the food was like. The air conditioning in the hotel was very good, and was even in the corridors outside the rooms. We used the open-top tour, which stopped just outside the Mirimar hotel next door, so was a good location. Also easy to walk back from Chinatown (takes about 15-20 mins) along the main road.

Reviews.Title: “good, but !!!”
Reviews.Author: treejon
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights for the grand prix and we had a room in the tower wing ,the room was big, very clean and well furnished but for 1 thing no shaver socket in the bathroom the hotel was in an ideal location for us as we could walk to the racing via the quaysides on both sides of the river with plenty of bars and restaurants although the better value restaurants are off the quays a couple of streets back ,really good local food which we loved. Now for the but !!!!!! WE WHERE CHARGED $75 DOLLARS FOR A EARLY CHECK IN which is scandalous!! ,we had emailed the hotel a couple of weeks before our arrival to inform them that we would be arriving at 9 am after a 13 hour overnight flight and a 8 hour time difference from the uk and would we be able to check in early ,as far as we are concerned the hotel saw this as a way of charging a couple of very tired travellers an extra $75 and for that alone i will book a different hotel next time

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT BOOK THIS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Corey S
Reviews.Content: I am currently in the military and was recalled due to humanitarian efforts in Thailand. I had booked the hotel through Agoda.com. Upon checking out the same day I checked in, I spoke to the front desk and was told that I had to get a refund from the booking company which was Agoda, and when I spoke to Agoda they mentioned that the hotel had to refund me. This went back and forth with both companies and was told by the Hotel that they were not going to refund us for a hotel room we didn't even stay in. I understand that we are US Armed Forces but when they are going through a disaster or in need of something the US Forces are the first in line to help, and something this small could not be handled by this hotel company. You can count that myself and EVERYONE I know will never be staying at this hotel. Thanks for NOTHING!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Average Business Class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Noskibabe1
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner visited Singapore for the first time to watch the F1 and do some sight seeing. On arrival to the hotel, the staff were friendly and courteous and we were given a room way before the appropriate check in time as our flight arrived early in the morning. The room was a standard double and had adequate facilities with a view facing the rear of the hotel. Although it was clean and tidy, the bathroom fittings were aging with some rusting around the edges. Overall though, this room was a base for us going out all day, every day so was fit for purpose. One annoyance, internet connection was stupidly expensive and per electrica item. for example, we had an ipad and two iphones and we would be charged three times for internet. We didn't bother in the end - wifi should be free! The location of the hotel is on the edge of Clarke Quay. If you leave the hotel and turn right on the foot path, you can take the road foot bridge and then follow the river upwards and you will walk straight past restaurants etc which is the start of Clarke Quay. Good way to get your bearings around the city. Next time we visit Singapore, we will spend more money and get a more central location as the MRT was a bit of a walk however the China Town MRT nearest the hotel hosts one of thefamous hawker centres. Don't let the image put you off, the stands are spotless and rigourously hygiene tested. We had platefuls of food and two huge Tiger beers for less than a tenner easily - very cheap and wonderful to eat if you are a foodie.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Experience”
Reviews.Author: ren1316
Reviews.Content: The whole experience from arrival to departure is not pleasent. Arriving to check in at 1 am, the checkin staff were not smiling/welcoming. They didn't have our booking. Had to log in to my email to retrieve my confirmation. We were given a so call superior room thinking that it is better than standard. It is most disappointing when we see our room. It is barely bigger than the bed. The bathroom is small to say the least. The key card wont open the door, went down to front desk to get sorted but staff dont believe me. Ask to have someone to come to my door to confirm. What an attitude! Read reviews before booking, someone mention this place had the best malaysian buffet. But that was not not breakfast, only lunch and dinner. So please avoid this place if you are able to. I wont be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: Asitb
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Expedia and were staying there for 2 nights. We were quite skeptical about the property since the reviews were very discouraging. Since it was Singapore, we were sure that the property would be decent if not gr8. Most of the hotels in Singapore allow you to check in only by 2.00 pm. However when we reached the hotel at 10.00 am we were overjoyed to hear that our room was ready and that we had been upgraded to a deluxe room. The room was small which was disapointing but since we would be out of the room for better part of the day...... it was alright. The staff in the hotel is extremly courteous and helpful. The property is also well located and is near to the Clark Quay and the Orchard Road. There is bus station just outside the hotel and the hotel also operates shittle services to Orchard Road. The area where the hotel is situate is peaceful and pleasing to the eye. The breakfast spread was not that great and the vegies really will have to survive on bread. Overall a good and wonderful experience and will be surely visiting this property when we are back again.

Reviews.Title: “Money for value & pretty decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravellingMalaysian
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a quiet area surrounded by public housing apartments. The famous Zouk disco is right besides this hotel but do not bother to go if you are above 21 years.. The room that I had was a tard too small but i guess for about SG245 per night it was all right. What I like : a. each access to Orchard Road , the ground zero for shopping in Singapore b.room service was efficient and flexible in their timing c.in room dining was fast and efficient d.breakfast was great e. has a dedicated bathing area and not limited to bath tub f. constant supply of driniking water g.room comes with ironing board What can be worked on are: a.front line staff can be a bit more attentive and friendly b.sometime you will have to wait 10 to 15 minutes for a cab c.the in room dining choice of food is limited so a wider choice would help d.the choice of TV channels is rather limited e.pillows can be a bit better - they need to be more firm and not overly soft f. lunch and dinner - choice is somewhat limited compared to other hotels

Reviews.Title: “Really good value for money hotel with helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: MasterLoader
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in Singapore for 4 nights enroute to our main holiday destination in Bali,the hotel is situated close to the harbour area which contains a huge variety of bars and restruants and is the best place to go at night, £9.50 a pint in a certain bar, but food excellent in most places, the bar within a pub has good value snacks. The hotels buffet meals seemed ok pricewise, but we preferred to eat out in the city as there were well cheaper diner type places in the shopping malls, and a great petrol station virtually next door selling a multitude of crisps, icecream and drinks(including beer)should you want to snack up in your room. One place that impressed us in one of the shopping malls was a restruant called Tartufos, specialising in Italian fare and run by a husband and wife team with excellent food and service-heartily recommend here to anyone, ask your taxi driver to take you there but make sure to arrange a pickup time for later. The reception staff were very helpful, as we had problems booking our online flight confirmation details, and we can say we enjoyed the open top city tour bus that stopped by the nearby hotel, good value and enjoyable in the Singapore sunshine!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Noshe
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centrally located and the rooms are clean & well decorated. The buffet breakfast had limited but good options. The reception area as well as the dining area is good. The hotel is best for business travelers coming to Singapore for business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Location ok,good enough for 3-4 days as a base!”
Reviews.Author: Dinaspowys
Reviews.Content: The hotel is functional and clean and the location for a walk along the riverside to Clarke Quay is fine. It was hard to judge the staff because we were out exploring,just a shame after a 13 hour flight you are met with 'your rooms are not ready until 2pm', we arrived at 9am! There are a number of restaurants within a 5 to 10 minute stroll, the distance should not put you off unless you struggle to walk. The 'sightseeing (red) bus' stops more or less outside the hotel, suggest if you want to explore the city you get a 2 day bus pass...around 33 singa dollars and you get a river cruise for free at Clarke Quay, just show your pass to the ticket office.

Reviews.Title: “4 star - absolutely not. Your saving grace your front desk staff”
Reviews.Author: Camelliafamily
Reviews.Content: Front desk staff wonderful in every respect. Changed rooms to 1926 after showing disappointment in your "superior" room. Apparently you do not have "standard" listed. The room was bigger, but badly stained carpet - not a good look and should be graded 'very standard and not 4 star." We had requested initially a non-smoking room!!!! both rooms were not smoke free but we agreed to try. Our booking was made weeks in advance. Breakfast was shocking, cold!!! and only choice then was to choose hot eggs. This was reported on day 2 - mine was reheated in the microwave but the rest remained cold with more than 1.5 hours to breakfast service to go. The remaining 3 days of our stay breakfast was STILL COLD. The chap in the dark suit should refrain from shuffling the breadrolls around and check the heat of the "supposedly hot" items. The breakfast staff were scruffy. Time for a shake up in that department. All this was reported in the hotel questionnaire when vacating. We have not heard back. Sorry although location good we will not be back and will advise our travel agent of this. After a 6 week tour of Europe and many hotels this was by far the worst. Disappointed New Zealanders. July 8th 2011.

Reviews.Title: “Good place for sleeping only”
Reviews.Author: msjvanrooy
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed at this hotel for 5 days while I was on business in Singapore. I was not particularly impressed. I stayed in this hotel since it was booked by my company, but will not go and stay there out of my own. The room was fairly small and noisy. There was a balcony but it was right above the aircon plant and the noise was overwhelming. The bathroom was real small, with the shower'n'bath combination, with the water either boiling or freezing. The food was pricey and we only ate only one lunch there - there are many foodcourts nearby where the locals eat and the food there is good and cheap. Having said this, breakfast was quite ok. The service was the normal Singaporean efficiency. Singapore is fairly pricey but better value can easily be found

Reviews.Title: “wonderfull enough to be here...”
Reviews.Author: lolipop80
Reviews.Content: very nice service received upon enter the hotel. greeted by bell/ porter in a good manner. hardly get in any singapore hotel nowadays. receptionist is well prepare and able to create good impression and check in was done smoothly. the front desk staff is very helpfull and they explain everything about the destination around the hotel regardless knowing im local. i still remember some of their name so later if any of u want to stay at this hotel can look for this friedly staff. wang yang, jackson, ragu, pei su and jasmine is some of the staff that i remember welcome me and assist me in polite and good way. pei su help me in check in and she is very helpfull. much remember is mr ramesh who is the manager who greeted me and assist me too. very good hotel and will be back here gain since this is my fvourite buss and leisure stay.!!

Reviews.Title: “WORST Hotel Stay Ever! The service provided during the stay was horrible...”
Reviews.Author: xtinakoh
Reviews.Content: Made a reservation for their suite to celebrate my husband's birthday. Thought I've gotten a very good promotional rate but it turned out to be a complete night mare. First I would like to commend the reservation staff for their good service, but that's about it. Everything after the confirmation of my reservation was a complete nightmare. I checked in with my baby and husband on 17 jun. When we arrived at the main lobby, we were first "welcomed" by the bellman who treated us like we were invisible. We were carrying our baby and a few bags and were struggling -- no one came to our aid. We then went to check in at the front desk with our baby and was greeted so "warmly" by the front desk staff. No smiles, greetings, everything was mechanical. It felt worse then those automated check in at the airport. We were then given a room,1101, the agent did not even asked for our preference of the room. So I thought this was redundant since i had already specified that I want a baby cot and a non smoking room during my reservation and I was with my baby at the point of check in. We happily took the lift and got to the 11th floor. The first thing we noticed was the overwhelming stench of cigarette smell. I told myself, the smell's just in corridor, they wouldn't be so senseless to give us a smoking room. Guess what? There was an ash tray in the room! We immediately called for a change of room and was then transferred to 1201. What a waste of time and what a "nice" check in experience. We then asked for baby cot as it wasn't there as requested. After which, we ordered food to our room. The only saving for the stay was the room service. Service was prompt and food was good. When the room service staff delivered our food, we again asked for the cot and this time, a baby high chair. He told us he was not from the department in charge and don't know what to do. We then called the guest service agent and requested for a high chair, to which, they couldn't provide. To cut short the story, the baby cot came only after 1.5 hours and we even had the hotel staff calling to question if we had reserved for a baby cot in advance! Basically communication between departments was horrible and our request for the cot was not passed down from reservation to front office. There was even a front office staff who called to check if housekeeping had sent the cot up. Shouldn't they call the housekeeping instead of the guest? In the evening, we went out for dinner. When we got back, the carpark was full and we were directed out of the carpark. Valet service was only offered after I told the staff I was an in-house guest at the exit. Shouldn't they ask before directing the guest out? I know this is a minor issue, but combined with the check-in experience, it made everything worse. At the valet, since we had to carry up some stuffs to our room, the valet staff called for the bellman to come. This was something that impressed me as after everything I'd experienced, my expectation was rather low. It turned out that I had to be disappointed again. It took the bellman more than 20 mins just to send the baggage up which he could have followed us and send it up immediately. I wouldn't have expected much from a 2 to 3 star hotel, but from a 4 star? This is rather appalling. The last and worst encounter was at the breakfast. The staff who guided us to our table was unfriendly, no smiles and not even a simple "good morning". My husband queued to get a freshly made omelette, when it was his turn, the chef, Ms Nancy [--]"greeted" him with a "YES!?". When he said he wanted an omelette, she simply started cooking and seemed so unhappy to cook. Upon receiving his omelette, my husband thank the chef, but she just stared back and didn't even smile or gave a reply. What's worse came after this. A foreigner, who was behind my husband, asked for an omelette, she even asked him what would he like in his omelette, i.e. everything or just ham and tomatoes. Is there something with the hotel that discriminates against locals? My husband thought it was just him being too sensitive so he decided to give Chef Nancy[--] another chance. He went back to the counter to get another omelette for me. The same response was given. This time round, her tone was even more rude. And on top of that, when she was about to place the completed omelette on the plate, she put it on a wet plate! The top plate was dry and clean, but for some reason, she removed it and put the omelette on the plate below, which was wet. She could have at least dried it! Overall, the stay was a terrible one. It was supposed to be a birthday celebration, in the end, it turned out to be a disaster. Maybe it's because we were on a promotional rate or maybe the hotel only attends to business guests since this is branded as a business hotel. Whichever the case, the 4-star service should be reflected throughout and provided equally, even if it was a complimentary stay. A note to all LOCALs, STAY AWAY from this hotel, they don't welcome locals.

Reviews.Title: “i have been there from 22nd of may till 28th of may on room no. 1622. name Deepak Kumar Gupta.”
Reviews.Author: Deepakmarine86
Reviews.Content: i have been there from 22nd of may till 28th of may on room no. 1622. name Deepak Kumar Gupta. Copthorne King’s is a 4-Star Boutique-style business hotel that prides itself on its warm and personal touch. Conveniently located minutes away from the Central Business District, Orchard Road, Chinatown & other shopping and entertainment districts, the hotel’s 310 contemporary rooms offer all the comforts of modern day amenities, replete with award-winning restaurants, 5 function rooms and recreational facilities such as a landscaped outdoor pool, mini putting green, gymnasium, sauna, steam bath and outdoor Jacuzzi. The hotel has created a niche market in the entertainment & sports industry and is the official hotel for many high profile events. This place is really well connected walking distance from clarque quay and other places in singapore. The chefs are excellent. and this place offers Penang buffet offered at Tien Court Restaurant is excellent, food served in real friendly environment as well as with very smiling filipino staffs.Strs cafe and prince terrace cafe also offers similar facility. Taking hotel dining in Singapore to new levels, Copthorne King’s Hotel Singapore offers a wonderful combination of tradition and modern to suit even the most discerning guest at a decent price. this hotel offers one queen or two single beds with pool, garden, city or river view, our rooms are of 18 square metres (193 square feet) and available from 3rd to 20th floor. In-room amenities include air conditioning, phone, voice mail, a computer data port, broadband connectivity, coffee or tea making facilities, a minibar, hairdryer and a personal safe. All rooms come equipped with a bath and shower. In addition, a flat screen TV with in-house movies, CNN and other premium channels are also provided. No matter which room type you stay in, you’ll receive the service and charm of a boutique hotel. Singapore is home to many hotels, but none can provide the level of personal attention that we at Copthorne King’s Hotel Singapore deliver with our unique brand of Asian hospitality. Copthorne King's Hotel Singapore is ideally located in the city centre by the historical Singapore river with easy access to major expressways and the Mass Rapid Transit. Close to the business and exhibitions districts of Shenton Way, HarbourFront Centre / Suntec City and the shopping & entertainment circuit of Orchard Road, Chinatown, Clarke Quay, Boat Quay and Robertson Quay. Close to the business and exhibitions districts of Shenton Way, HarbourFront Centre / Suntec City and the shopping & entertainment circuit of Orchard Road, Chinatown, Clarke Quay, Boat Quay and Robertson Quay. Close to the business and exhibitions districts of Shenton Way, HarbourFront Centre / Suntec City and the shopping & entertainment circuit of Orchard Road, Chinatown, Clarke Quay, Boat Quay and Robertson Quay.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we needed”
Reviews.Author: CrisIba
Reviews.Content: We began our honeymoon in Singapore and chose this hotel especially for its great location. The room was small and clean and offered pretty much all that is necessary for a 4 night stay. We used to go around Singapore a lot, so we did not spend much time inside the hotel. However, we found as a great minus the lack of free Internet connection and the high price of this service. We also think that breakfast could be introduce in the fare of the room as this last one was not small at all:). We also had issues with the air conditioning system which we found noisy and tough to deal with at night.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel / Small Rooms”
Reviews.Author: jmyan
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for four nights. Our room is very small. Hotel is ok if you're going to stay there to sleep and nothing else but sleep. :) + but in terms of proximity, About 10 to 15mins walk to Clark quay and China town + small bathroom + breakfast/food, not enough choices + S$6.80 to S$10 taxi fare to sentosa + S$20 to 25 taxi fare from airport to the hotel vis a vis + they would not automatically clean your room and replenish toiletries, you have to press "make up room button" before leaving. + No free WIFI

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Selloy
Reviews.Content: We just stayed 1 night over there and it was ok. Not a luxury hotel but it was clean and well located. The breakfast buffet was really nice so if you don’t need a hotel for relaxing this should be a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “excellent service”
Reviews.Author: deepakmarine
Reviews.Content: the services were excellent, location is best , connectivity is available to all the parts of Singapore and Staffs are well mannered. We have stayed at many hotels over the years, often luxury ones with impeccable details and fantastic designs. and i had good time allt together.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: glittergal13
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel en route to Sydney for 2 nights. Was very concerned before trip having read some of the reviews, and did in fact contact the management to "voice" my concerns. However, upon arrival found all staff very pleasant and helpful. Room in tower section was small but quite adequate for 2 nights, and 5 pieces of luggage. Breakfast again was perfectly adequate and on our package was included in the price. On the final day the luggage was taken from us on checkout and ready for collection again at 3 pm when our taxi arrived. Would have no qualms about staying here again. All areas of the hotel we used during our stay were perfectly clean and the restaurant was very clean and no tables were left with dirty dishes on them for any length of time.

Reviews.Title: “Ask for it..”
Reviews.Author: Globetr8r
Reviews.Content: The hotel has rooms of varying quality. Those who do not ask will get rooms towards the noisy cooling system on the rear or at a smoking floor. By asking for at non-smoking quiet room you end in the better part of the hotel and will enjoy a good sleep in calm surroundings. For some reason the better room was also cleaner. Staff very helpful and polite, suitcase storage after checkout (which is as late as noon), changing room available after checkout. Nice, if you walk the town while awaiting next flight. Nice restaurant and breakfast buffet - somewhat costly, though.

Reviews.Title: “Passable - just”
Reviews.Author: milliecharlie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is pretty characterless, and the lack of any warmth from the staff does not help. My first impression was not good when there was no door service or concierge, and I had to drag my three bags up the stairs and through the lobby by myself while the check in staff looked on. I was however upgraded to a "deluxe" room - but I would hate to see what the standard rooms look like! The bathroom was so small that you had to almost stand on the toilet to be able to close the door, and it lacked basic amenities such as a clock. The bed was a rock - the hardest bed I have ever (tried) to sleep in. The next morning I went down to breakfast, which was almost inedible. Stale packet croissants, "tang" flavoured orange juice which was slopped out of the kitchen by a staff member in a plastic bucket to refill the dipenser - you get the picture. The location is also not very good if you do not want to eat at the hotel. It is not really near anything. Luckily I only stayed here one night as I was "passing through". I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Business and Pleasure Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ParagTavkar
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week, while on a business tour. The hotel is ideally located and good spacious, well done rooms. The toilets are clean and well designed. The beds are excellent and you get a good rest after a tiring day. There several options for food and the breakfast is well spread. The service is excellent and staff very courteous.

Reviews.Title: “thoroughly enjoyable stay with clean rooms,helpfull staff,good food and much more”
Reviews.Author: PieceOfPizza
Reviews.Content: very attentive staff including front office, house keeping and restaurant. small but cozy and clean rooms of pretty good condition with TV.room was made up quite on time with clean linen.extra facilities available FOC for in house guests like pool steam bath and sauna. if you forgot your toothbrush don't worry, you will find a disposable with toothpaste in the bathroom.no complaints at all.enjoyed a nice and relaxing few days.

Reviews.Title: “Book somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: Deb50_11
Reviews.Content: The room was small, a dirty plate in the wardrobe! Dont be fooled by Superior Room, that really means budget room, we walked along a very nice corridor to our room only to have to then walk through a service area into the next corridor that immediately told you the rooms were going to be a big disappointment, I used a bottle of water thinking it was complimentary which it had been at our last two hotels, only to find i had been charged over 12 dollars for it. The breakfast was very basic, by the time you had served yourself and then got the coffee from the machine everything was cold. The staff at the front desk could also be a little bit more friendly, we didnt exactly get a warm friendly welcome. I wont be returning to this chain of hotels again, We called in at the Marriot and the concierge was so friendly, he even got us a taxi, and told us places to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Rude Reception Staff”
Reviews.Author: Ricco1966
Reviews.Content: Arrived @ hotel @ 5pm after a long flight from Johanessburg . Reception greeted me as follow" Yes what do you want " . Rooms not ready and they wanted a 300 SD Deposit for mini bar . The items in the mini bar were 2 cokes , i mineral water , 1 small pkt chips. Brealfeast is till 10 ,30 , For our first b/feast we arrived in dining hall @ 10.05 only to be told by old lady that they close @ 10.30 .These people are absolutely rude and this hotel should be avoided at all cost .

Reviews.Title: “I don't want to die in the shower”
Reviews.Author: batkung
Reviews.Content: I just slipped twice in the shower, no anti-slip mats available.. I called the manager and all he was concerned about was the possibility of being sued, not the fact that guests should have anti-slip mats in the first place. I may take this to a lawyer...I didn't hurt myself that much, but what pisses me off the most is that a simple rubber mat was not available...I've stayed in much cheaper hotels who care more about their guests. this place is 340sgd a night at present(special deal), with no breakfast and no internet....have you ever had the feeling you've been conned?

Reviews.Title: “Very attentive and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Pitch0un
Reviews.Content: The location is not in the city center, but not that far from it. Close to Chinatown and the river where you can walk along. The staff is really nice. The only bad point is there is a noisy air-conditioning station in the backside of the hotel. Our room was just in front of it, so very noisy when you want to use the balcony.

Reviews.Title: “Try another hotel..”
Reviews.Author: 1alg
Reviews.Content: We were so dissapointed by this hotel! For what you havebeen to pay, the standard of cleaning and service should be so much better. We had to complain about the cleaning of the room. On the toilet it was dried in "personal waste" from previous guest!!! Yes! Later the toilet would not flush, so we needed help for that. The hot water fame and went during the dag. Most of the time there was no hot water! And the pressure of the water made it impossible to wash my hair (long hair - soap wont come out). The internet did not work in the room, and no help given. Only internet we could get in hotel was in the lobby. They had only two chairs to sit in, in the lobby, so you had to standard somewhere and check your emails!! Its awful noise from the air condition fans behind the hotel.. On the other side is the road, so guess all rooms would be noisy. (but Singapore is a town where it is hard to avoid traffic!) The rooms where so dusty, I had to wipe the tables and shelf myself! After the first day we tried to find another hotel, but after quite a few calls we could not find any available. Also we had somewhere clothes for laudry, including babyclothing. They were not properly cleaned when we got it back. Locationwise hotel is not too bad. But I would not stay here with a little child again. Rather be more sentral, as it is too hot to walk long distances with baby. Can not recommend this hotel to anyone, unless it is the only hotel available in town/the country!

Reviews.Title: “Good costly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sridharan K
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location. However the rates are little costly. Rooms are samll particularly those in the tower room. Staff are friendly and helpful. Breakfast has god spread and some days surprisingly has Indian parratas too.

Reviews.Title: “Executive standard hotel in Economy Price”
Reviews.Author: Busyman03
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended by one of my business associate in Singapore. Based on the price i assumed it to be an average hotel, but when i went to the hotel for check-in, i was quite amazed with the ambiance and the hospitality. They are really very quick and within 5 mins i was escorted to my room. No wonder they serve wonderful breakfast. I would strongly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, but clean sheets”
Reviews.Author: Fredo321
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nothing special: small rooms with a tiny bath tub, clean sheets, fresh towels, but you don't need more to rest for a couple of hours. Staff at the reception is helpful. Breakfast buffet is average, but overprized. I probably should have stayed in one of the major hotels in Singapore for a bit more money, which would provide a better value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “pretty bad overall”
Reviews.Author: littletuxedomen
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my significant other for a one-night getaway... we were put in a superior room i think, under the Teddy Bear Weekend special. upon arrival, check-in was pretty standard, not the friendliest but still alright. the room we got, however, was BAD. i did not request for one with a pool view, and on hindsight i should have because we were given one that was right above the vents/fans and it was a hideous sight. not only that, the room smelled extremely musty the moment we stepped in, like the carpet had not be cleaned for ages. there were stains on the carpeted floor as well. what was ridiculous was how little attention was paid to all these basic things that should be present, ESPECIALLY given that it's marketed as a 4* hotel if im not wrong. there was only one bathrobe and one set of slippers, (despite the fact that it was made clear from the start that 2 people were going to be staying) and the room service menu that you could hang on the door for breakfast was an old one that was partially filled in, probably by the previous guest. this made me suspect that maybe they did not even clean the room properly after the previous guest checked out, and i got a bit wary of the cleanliness of that set of bathrobe and slippers. and the drawers were all so dusty i was afraid to really touch or open them. and yes the bathroom was tiny! there was only enough space for one person to stand at the sink at any given time, and there was no 'breadth' to speak of: shower on one side, sink on the other side, toilet right in front of you, and if you backed up two spaces you would collide with the back of the bathroom door. absolutely no standing space at all. the only saving grace of that stay was the breakfast, which was pretty decent in terms of taste and variety. but after the breakfast we both couldn't wait to check out of the hotel. a waste of $200 that could've been spent better.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Small Rooms”
Reviews.Author: DipikaMumbai
Reviews.Content: This could have been avoided. Unfortunately we made our bookings for the Singpaore trip rather late and were able to find only this hotel which offered available rooms on the dates of our stay. While it was well located , within walking distance of Clarke Qyuay and other major areas, the ROOMS WERE ASTONISHINGLY SMALL. So were the bathrooms. I didn't seem value for monry at all. In that budget I could have stayed at a better hotel or could have found something cheaper which would have offered me the same rooms. The service was not bad though, I must admit.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, fair value, though not very central”
Reviews.Author: honkiehoteler
Reviews.Content: Very good value for money; decent rooms (bathroom was on the small side, but didn't bother me - as I was alone anyway), good internet connection, good breakfast & an adequate gym (I booked a business room so all of these were included). Location is not bad, though not central. A short walk to places or take taxi (no MRT nearby).

Reviews.Title: “A decent budget place right in the middle of all action”
Reviews.Author: FebyThomas07
Reviews.Content: One main reason we chose this hotel was its location and price. The rooms in the tower are moderns but a little congested. The service of course when compared to hotels in India is not great although the concierge was a really helpful person. We basically spent two night at the hotel, most of the time were out exploring singapore. The sleep quality and the bathrooms are nice and modern. I would call this a budget luxury hotel.

Reviews.Title: “If you're on business then stay elsewhere or upgrade your room...”
Reviews.Author: Biffo888
Reviews.Content: My client booked me into the Copthorne in Havelock Road and from the outside it looks OK. I had a "Superior" room in the Wing of the hotel and it was as tiny and poorly shaped as any shoebox. I've had bigger hotel rooms in Tokyo and that's saying something. I asked to see a "De Luxe" room in the main hotel and it was what I would have expected from a hotel of this nature. So the first learning point is that if you want to work in your room then don't go "Superior" and ensure that the Broadband is included in the price...the same way as breakfast may or may not be included depending on who made the booking. Havelock Road isn't really near anywhere so it's a taxi ride to everywhere you want to go. There are dozens of business hotels better located than this...try the Hilton in Orchard Road or the Pan Pacific/Mandarin/Oriental over near Sun Tec city. The hotel is about 3.5 stars. The buffet is fine but not cheap and the coffee shop seemed very expensive. A cappucino cost a small fortune. There's no lounge to speak of so finding a place to relax isn't easy when you leave your room. All in all Singapore is an extraordinarily competitive hotel market and anyone with a few minutes to spare should be able to find a better located and better value hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience and value!”
Reviews.Author: RSP510
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at this hotel, and really loved our experience. The hotel staff were very friendly, and helpful. The rooms were clean, modern, and the beds were extremely comfortable. The location was great, and we were able to walk to many places. They also provide a free shuttle to the main areas in Singapore, which worked out great for us. For our few days at this hotel, we felt it really became our home. We generally don't use the fitness facilities at hotels, but felt like they really hit the mark with theirs, so took advantage of the pool/sauna/steam room. The pool and hot tub were also great, and most of the time we were able to enjoy them to ourselves. Any other guests we would run into were very friendly. We would definitely stay here again, especially since we found it so affordable compared to many other hotels in Singapore. Overall, great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel near River”
Reviews.Author: SUBIRGHOSH
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice and clean. Also the are is very nice. Near to Clark quey. But rooms are small. As we were travelling with children on 2nd day we were changed to a family room with an extra bed without any extra cost. We ordered food in room service, quality was good.

Reviews.Title: “Poor choice”
Reviews.Author: HDMDenmark
Reviews.Content: We arried at 1930 and our rooms were not ready we had to wait for an hour to get the room... We had bought the executive package but this was actually only a very small facility only with drinks for 2 hours... Breakfest was at the best on avarage.. Take another hotel if you are going to Singapore..

Reviews.Title: “Everything is a problem . . .”
Reviews.Author: Taggart75
Reviews.Content: Just spent 2 nights here as the last leg of a 4 week world tour with my wife here last weekend. Our first impressions of the place were good as we drove in, its location close to Robertson Quay and Clarke Quay beyond is good. However the problems started at check in. We handed in the voucher for the room and after a few minutes of limited communication we were told that there were no double bed rooms available and that we must take a twin room . . . no options ! We refused to budge and were offered a 'better' room with balcony still a twin though and that we could move into the standard double the next night if we wanted - reluctantly we accepted. The room on entry seemed 'damp' to include the linen. Maybe this is just a Singapore thing with the high humidity. Thankfully the air con worked and within half an hour it was ok. The window to the balcony would only part open and then jammed - joy ! We decided it best to stay in the room for both nights for fear of worse. On day of departure 2 different members of staff advised us that with our late flight we after checking out could after a day in the city in the heat have use of a room for a shower on one of the upper floors to freshen up - no problem. When we at the relevant time asked for this (3 times) I was told this was not possible and that I wouldn't have been told this and I had misunderstood - only the swimming pool showers were an option, not the end of the world grant it but as it turned out with no air con and lots of kids splashing about in the changing rooms a 'hot and busy' experience ! CONS - as above and staff on the whole not very helpful or obliging with a Concierge that was hopeless at anything more complicated than hailing a taxi ! PROS - as advertised the restaurant do a popular Panang Malaysian style buffet every night and as a European trying this was our best experience in the hotel and whilst I wouldn't recc staying here I would advise on going there for this dining experience which was fantastic ! Hope this helps

Reviews.Title: “Great staff - awful hotel :(”
Reviews.Author: Orangina1977
Reviews.Content: We arrived very late after a long delay in London and went straight to our rooms. The room we had was ok but my kids were not so lucky and a dirty room that looked like it had just been vacated. The staff tried to help but the alternatives offered were on different floors and I wante dus to be together on one floor (we had asked for adjoining but none were available). We managed to change both rooms the next day - again the staff helped us to pack up and move - and the new rooms were better. It seemed the hotel didn't have enough staff and everyone was very harassed. Long line to check out and we were wrongly charged for breakfasts that we supposed to be included but overall the location was good, rooms average and the staff very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Run Down and Dirty!”
Reviews.Author: kathylong
Reviews.Content: My company put me up in this hotel and it was awful. The carpets are filthy with spots, my room was not dusted, luke-warm water and little water pressure. My room didn't have a full length mirror and the bathroom is tiny with little counter space. I ordered room service from the chinese restaurant and the portions were so small. The chile chicken had 3 small pieces of chicken covered with 25 dried chiles.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Travelbugs10114
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a couple of nights after a cruise, what a step up from our terrible room on the boat. Well located, reasonably priced, no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Again in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: BizTraveler2000
Reviews.Content: A business trip to Singapore took me here. Stayed for 3 days. The hotel is fine with most business amenities. The service is ok. Though the breakfast was not very good. The front desk is ok, but could have been quicker. It is close to one side of the quay, so you are not far away from eating options. Though nothing is too far in Singapore, this place looked a bit away from the key areas. Good but can be better.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: cuteadi
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights. Hotel was nice, especially the Bfast was great. Staff was helpful and so was the concierge. centrally located. I guess hotel rooms in Spore are small in size. Comfortable stay for two people. Comfortable bedding / bathroom was nice and clean. Honestly, no issues per se. A good 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty perfect business option”
Reviews.Author: mosquita
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel at least once a month. At first glance, it's nothing special - but it does everything a business hotel should. Expedient room service, with good quality "staples" (noodles, club sandwich etc), lovely beds, decent toiletries, bathrobe/slippers. Deluxe rooms are significantly better than standard ones, with balconies and very roomy. The best bit is the location - across the street from Robertson's Quay and a few minutes walk from Great World City - so food, drinks and shopping all taken care of. This hotel is not an "experience", but it's an effective 4-star choice. I've stayed in 5-stars that couldn't get the basics right, so appreciate it when I see it... Only small improvement I would recommend would be free room wi-fi.

Reviews.Title: “excellant services with average rooms”
Reviews.Author: bhagyesh
Reviews.Content: a nice people place for travel.good ser bvices if you have any problem. easily accessible staff. good food. rooms are average quality.a bit small.bus servise for sightseeing is good.can upgrade to good rooms if not satisfied free.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: johnny_5_bellys
Reviews.Content: Checked in and got a free upgrade – all good. Hotel rooms very nice, clean and quiet and a decent view from balcony. Location of hotel is good, just cross the road and wander down the scenic water front for 10 - 15 mins and you’re at Clarke quay. Near enough to be central but far enough away to escape the noise.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: mazmohad
Reviews.Content: Nothing great & nothing bad. We had booked for our 1 day Singapore stop over en route to Bali. Breakfast was good, cleanness was satisfactory and overall the hotel is very Good for the value. There is a bus stop right in front of the hotel and the same stop is used by guided tour buses. There are many tour bus that you can hop on and buy tickets for unlimited 24hr travel. So good for visitors. Metro / Train station (Bugis) is also close-by through a bus transfer.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Quiet Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Meloncory
Reviews.Content: Visited the hotel before booking a room for 2 nights. Had slight difficulties looking for it. After seeing it, was not too keen to spend the weekend there. However, I took a chance and decided to go ahead with the plan anyway. On the day of check-in, the staff at the counter was very pleasent and friendly. The Deluxe room looks like it does in the hotel's website, so there is no complaints. The room is clean and comforable. I was designated a smoking room as I had requested for one. The smell of smoke is quite obvious on that level, even as a smoker, I found it a tat bit strong. Maybe they can improve on this. My balcony faced the swimming pool, relatively all right view, only the cooling towers was directly beneath and was quite noisy. Overall, the two nights were a surprisingly great stay. Rooms were reasonably charged. The food in the hotel however is slightly pricey, you'd be better off venturing out and the petrol kiosk(with a 7-11) is just a brisk walk away fo drinks and snacks etc... Will not hesitate to stay in the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A good and decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gitangel
Reviews.Content: I was'nt to keen on this hotel when my agent booked it mainly because it wasnt at orchard road and secondly I hadnt heard about it all. Sure, I was pleasantly surprised when my cab dropped me there. It was a decent, business hotel with good exteriors and a fair sized compound. The security was well-trained and helpful at the hotel and so was the staff. The lobby was warm and welcoming. One had to pass to the open dining area past the lounge to get to the elavators to the tower. The rooms and the bathroom were small as compared to those in Bangkok or Malaysia but well furnished and equipped. The hotel was away from the main areas but close to clarke quay. Transport, mostly taxis were available and also there was a bus stop right outside the hotel where one could even get a hop on hop off bus.The hotel also had a shuttle service to orchard road and clarke quay areas at certain timings. The hotel had a cute little shop tucked away in one corner of the lobby having the necessities as well as some cute souveniers and nik naks. I had a very pleasant four day stay here and would recommend for its safety and tranquility of the sarroundings.

Reviews.Title: “Overnight Stop-over Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Commenteer
Reviews.Content: Our itinary was a 3 night stay in Singapore followed by an 11 night holiday in Bali. The Copthorne Kings had come quite highly recommended and is a popular choice with travel agents arranging two centre holidays of this kind. On our arrival we had to wait for an hour or so whilst a room was made available. The reception and entrance areas we're pleasant and comfortable enough seemingly more 3* than 4* although food and drinks prices crept nearer to being 5*. When finally our room was ready and having requested a double room when booking, we found we had been allocated a very small twin room (in the tower?) with almost no luggage / cupboard space and a tiny bathroom with 'sit-up bath'. Apparently a Superior room, though superior to what was unclear! By now, having travelled for more than 18hrs, we were resigned to just getting some sleep and so took the room. In summary, the rooms in the tower maybe suitable for an individual on an overnight stay; but for two people with holiday luggage, forget it!! Recommendation - quiz your travel agent before you go and check what it takes to upgrade to a 'Superior' hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: scouser79
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the Copthorne for 2 nights on our way to Malaysia. The hotel was in a great location. They had really nice rooms with modern well equipped bathrooms. The bar area and restaurant were nice. A good comfortable hotel

Reviews.Title: “Underrated”
Reviews.Author: scottishtraveller74
Reviews.Content: I thought this hotel was fantastic, the staff could not do enough for you and they even phoned our room when taxis etc arrived early when we were not at reception. The location is pretty good, less than 10 mins walk to a metro and plenty of buses giong past the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Pretty nice Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Afty
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Copthorne King's Hotel on Havelock road on multiple occasions, and it remains reliable and consistent in its service and hospitality. The hotel is across the road from the nice wlkway going along Boat and Clark Quay, which makes it an excellent location if you like walking. However, if you dont, then the nearest MRT station is only at CQ and is a fair bit away and you'll have to take a cab every time. The food is pretty good, though I am not the biggest fan of their buffets. I prefer the little coffee shop, which dishes out some pretty good fish n chips. The rooms are well furnished with all the amenities you would expect from a good business hotel. The staff is friendly, and the room service is quite prompt. There is a small swimming pool and jacuzzi on the terrace of one of the lower floors, and also a very basic gymnasium. Would recommend it, but you would better make sure you know the exact location of the place and dont get an unpleasant surpise.

Reviews.Title: “Good all round hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pete084
Reviews.Content: First leg of our Far East trip this hotel was booked for us by a friend who lives out there. I think the key to our stay was having one of the Exec rooms which gave us access to the Exec lounge where each evening for a couple of hours we were able to get free drinks and snacks - these freshly cooked by the Chef there. Anyway before that - check in was brilliant - lhotel staff anxius to please - there are lots of bell boys around the concierge desk who helped us with lots of things - taxis etc - there is also a free shuttle bus into Orchard Road / Clarke Quay . The hop on hop off bus also passes close to this hotel. Breakfast was good - lots of choice and across the board service was 10/10 - couldn't fault anything. Pool is welcoming ( we swam in a tropical rain storm !) with towels supplied. Our room was very comfortable and very clean - a definite re-visit hotel. One tip - we were after some wine to take to our friends' apartment - alcohol is quite expensive in Singapore BUT there is a petrol station almost next door which stocks wine etc plus snacks at reasonable prices!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel. Expensive food.”
Reviews.Author: acension1000
Reviews.Content: As hotels go this is one of the most helpful places I stayed. the staff were nice, and spoke excellent English. The room was large and clean. try for one of the tower rooms as it has a nice bay window to watch lighting storms over the city. Breakfast was excellent with a wide choice. My only adverse comment is the price of dining there. I tried the buffet on arrival, and (my own fault I guess), my small meal came to 22 GBP. It was a nice enough meal but not at that price. The location is not remote, but because of the heat, the fifteen minute walk to the metro is enervating. The shuttles to shopping centres leave in the morning and return in the afternoon. So it is not a constant flow. Taxi's are probably the choice. The cheapest and better places to eat are actually behind the hotel. About five minutes away to the left and rear. Avoid the Quayside restuarants which are expensive and further away. The staff were helpful and printed etickets off for me at no charge.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected surprise .......”
Reviews.Author: guoquan11
Reviews.Content: went for my birthday celebration stay during 07-09/11/09. Had a lovely surprise upon checking in when the staff mentioned they will upgrade our room from superior to their Club room. Thumbs up to the Management & staff which made this stay wonderful. Keep up the good job.

Reviews.Title: “handy and quiet”
Reviews.Author: velogiant
Reviews.Content: We had a 24 hour stop over so we used this room for a quick sleep and to store our gear at the beginning of a 6 week holiday. Breakfast was a bit pricey so was found the local shopping centre and got a good breakfast for less. The hotel has a free bus that runs by it, so we used this to get to Orchard Rd. Once we got to Orchard Rd, we used the underground train to get around. The hotel let us use the showers at the pool before we headed out to the airport to continue on our holiday. Handy and quiet for a fun stopover.

Reviews.Title: “High On Value... Not so high on comfort...”
Reviews.Author: EdLuva
Reviews.Content: Was in Singapore last month for the F1 Grand Prix with a bunch of mates and needed a place to stay that was reasonably well priced yet not really in the backpacker realm. Copthorne Kings was certainly good value for money and by no means was this the worst place Ive stayed at. Staff at the Kings were excellent... very polite and accomodating to everything we requested and could not fault them at all in that area. The hotel and rooms were all clean, well lit and the air con was excellent which is a must when the outdoor temp is a constant 33 degrees and 75% humidity... even at 3.30am!?!?!?!?! Now whilst the size of our room - which was apparently the the biggest room before moving up to a suite - was not too bad, the bathroom was... well tiny! I'm 6 foot 4 and standing in the middle of the bathroom i could virtually touch both walls, and its in this space where there is a shower/bath, toilet and sink. Not the most comfortable of bathing experiences and I'm a stickler for a good shower before heading out on the town. The beds also got a red card from me as they were waaaaaaay too firm... Actually some of the boys in the traveling party resorted to sleeping on the couch as this was actually a hell of a lot softer than the beds which were probably a shade softer than concrete... I know some chiropractor somewhere is creaming themselves over the first firm bed in hotel history, but give me a soft and cushy sack anytime! And the single bed size wasn't peachy either... almost fell out of bed a number of times... Finally the location is a little bit of a remote one... whilst there are a few hotels in the immediate vicinity, there isn't actually any major MRT lines servicing the area and taxis are heavily relied upon to get you to the nearest station (we tended to use Orchard Road). Though in all fairness its not a massive taxi fare especially when splitting it in a group. Couple of tips if you do stay here... Use the showers in the gym change rooms... each stall is as big as the bathroom in a regular room... dunno if this is kosher with the hotel but hey... got my daily spacious shower fix there with no problems. And to get around rock a taxi out to 'Ion Orchard' and then walk next door to the main MRT station... shouldn't cost you any more than 5-8 Sing dollars per trip... you can try find a bus near the hotel but this way you don't build up a sweat in the sauna that is daytime Singapore. And to all the nightclub fans... look no further than Zouk... about a 5 minute stumble down the road. All in all probably wouldn't stay here next time I'm in Singers as I'll opt for a more pimped out Hotel but if you are on a budget and subscribe to the old "A hotel room is merely to leave my bags" credo then I could certainly recommend the Copthorne Kings to you.

Reviews.Title: “Very good, beside breakfast”
Reviews.Author: felixinbali
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 1 night, great Hotel, clean modern Room, Big flat screen TV, good bed. Location is ok, its a little bit far to the next MRT but I knew that before. Only the breakfast was a big disappointment: The scrambled eggs obviously made from egg powder and the bread (French Baguette) tasted somehow old and to soft. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Internet is on the expensive side: around 25 SGD for 24 hours. 4* for the hotel and room 2* for the breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
