Reviews.Author: alokbishnoi
Reviews.Content: I visited Singapore in Jul 2005. It was my first foreign trip. The stay was arranged by my company. My first impressions of the Hotel were excellent. The Room was very spacious. The service was good. The buffet breakfast had a very large spread. The Food at the restaurent was not that great. The menu had Indian cuisine also but it looked and tasted completely different. The hotel is walking distance from the best pub in town. All in All a great place to be.

Reviews.Title: “Well done!”
Reviews.Author: LS_Wong
Reviews.Content: Not bad at all, from my point of view. Anyhow, the hotel just served as our nest at night, we really had no idea about the performance of the day staffs, as well as other daytime-operation facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Horrific”
Reviews.Author: michelle002
Reviews.Content: This has got to be one of the worst hotels that I have ever stayed at. My husband and I were relocating to Singapore from the US. His company told us that we were staying at the Copthorne King's hotel for 2 weeks. The reviews didn't seem great, but they seemed OK, so we weren't too worried. We checked in with no issues and went up to the room to wait for our luggage. We had 8 suitcases since we were moving here, so it took 2 people to bring them up. My husband was not in the room when they arrived and the 2 men who brought our luggage would not even acknowledge me. I asked questions and was completely ignored. They just dumped our luggage by the door and left me to move them. I was very upset at being treated this way. Then I had to move our luggage around. The room was quite small. It probably would have been fine if we had a normal amount of luggage, but it was almost impossible to fit our stuff and us in the room at the same time. The room was also very dirty. There were piles of dirt and dust in the corners, the carpet had burn marks, and the shower was moldy and full of mildew. The walls of our room were so thin that we were woken up at night by our neighbors phone ringing. We could hear when they received text messages and we could hear the very quiet music that they played in the hallway. It was horrible! There are no reasonably priced places to eat nearby - especially for breakfast. We ate breakfast at the hotel one morning and it was very good - but it cost us $52 for the 2 of us. Great World City mall is nearby and there is a good food court, but that's really the only option. There is a bus stop across the street, but there is no nearby MRT. My husband begged his company to move us and they would not, They called the hotel and they offered to move us to another room. We went to look at the room before we moved all our luggage, and while the carpet was newer, it was still dirty and while there was less mold and mildew in the bathroom, it still wasn't clean. So we didn't feel that it was worth it to move. When we tried to explain this to the man at the front desk, he just shrugged his shoulders. Eventually, enough high-ranking people at my husband's company yelled at the HR representative and they agreed to move us to the Swissotel The Stamford - which in comparision was heaven on earth. We still spent a full week at the Copthorne Kings which was way to long. I wouldn't recommend this place to my worst enemy - it's that bad.

Reviews.Title: “good three star hotel than four”
Reviews.Author: chiahong1
Reviews.Content: just spent 7 nites here.i go to spore often and stayed in different hotels from 3 to 5 star. This is a very good 3 star in my opinion. it is definitely too far to walk to the MRT. I recommend catching the bus from outside the hotel. the routes are at the bus-stop they are frequent and cheap. e.g if you get off at chinatown MRT station walk to the bus stop pass OG dept. store in People's Park there are two buses will drop you right outside the hotel. i bought a ez link card. The hotel also runs a shuttle if you can fit in. do not eat the scramble egg from the display at breakfast. it is the most disgusting. the chef is there to cook whatever egg you want fresh and v. gd.although it is not advertised.i only found out as i saw a guest waiting for his egg.my only complain is the attitude of the chef, to get me to accept a plain omelette he had cooked earlier and when i refused as i wanted a ham omelette he showed his displeasure.chef, learn to smile and say no problem! singapore itself is food heaven.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Palan
Reviews.Content: A conference in Singapore brought us to this Hotel. Fantastic View, very near to the River. Good and clean rooms, a very polite and ready-to-help staff. Very good location for Breakfast on open terrace. Even after check-out, one can request for an evening shower before taking the flight back home. A very good Hotel and a value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “A great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: UkCaptain
Reviews.Content: Excellent service from arrival to departure. A free upgrade to a spacious room on arrival. Greal location for food/nightlife at Clarke Quay (just 10 mins on foot). Great food both breakfast and dinner. I stayed previously at the Meritus Mandarin that cost considerably more, yet this hotel beats it in every way!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our short stay in Singapore...”
Reviews.Author: SharonBLondon
Reviews.Content: Due to a cancelled flight from Singapore onto Thailand we were lucky enough to spend 1 night in Singapore staying at the Copthorne Kings and it was perfect for our needs. Hotel itself had nice, fair size rooms with comfortable bed, en suite bathroom/shower and a small balcony. The staff were friendly and welcoming and the hotel was modern and well kept and when we had some trouble using our safety deposit box (the person before had left it locked without leaving the code - clever...) they sent staff up to correct this within 5 mins so as not to waste any of our short time in Singapore. Breakfast buffet was also fine with a choice of foods and drinks to suit most tastes. Hotel is located near to the quays (Robertson, Boat etc) and is a nice walk along the river through all of the quays in the evening. Some people have mentioned this hotel is a little out of the way and we werent in Singapore long enough to comment on this but we found it to be within easy walking distance of the quay areas so perfect for our evening out in Singapore as the quays have plenty of shops, bars and restaurants as well as boat rides up and down the river for sight seeing if you wish. Cabs and buses seemed plentiful to reach other areas if you wished. Singapore is clean, pretty and safe and was the perfect stop over on our way to Thailand.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: dangboy
Reviews.Content: COPTHORNE KINGS is one of the best Hotels available in SINGAPORE and is centrally located with all major business center locations and places to enjoy available on easy access. Food quality is very good and the rooms are spacious providing an excellent view of the city and the swimming pools beneath on the ground floor.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for Singapore”
Reviews.Author: CeesTT
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights after we stayed 3 night in the Scarlet hotel. This is something completely different from the Scarlet. The hotel has less atmosphere but it's still a very good choice. The rooms are large for Singapore (standard for the rest of the world). The bathroom is very small. We got a free upgrade to a room with a balcony and a view on the Singapore River. Unfortunately there is no metro close to the hotel so you have to walt or take a taxi. We did a nice walk alond the Singapore River to the Boat Quay. The direct surrounding of the hotel is not interesting witj only hotels. For your first time in Singapore the Scarlet is a better (but more expensive) place to stay because it's at the edge of Chinatown.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for business”
Reviews.Author: Chakotay425
Reviews.Content: Good location for a business trip to Singapore. The hotel is well located and is quite accessible to some major shopping areas. It was a short car trip to Sentosa from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: fullydepreciated055
Reviews.Content: The hotel was actually recommended by our travel agent and as we like to experience different hotels each time we visit we decided to give it a whirl. Check-in staff were very friendly and efficient and upgraded us to a de-luxe room which was greatly appreciated. Although the room was smaller than we expected it was quite adequate and extremely comfortable. The furnishings were really nice, the beds really comfy and the duvets so cozy. I got the impression that the rooms had been recently renovated. The bathroom though tiny was well planned but a bit cramped when two of us got in their at the same time. The buffet breakfast was really good, both in variety and presentation. We had a very late (or should I say a very early) flight home and normally we would shower and change at the airport as check out is12 noon but they very kindly offered us facilities on the 3rd floor that were such that we gladly made use of them instead. My only complaint (more a disappointment really) was that there were no coffee/tea making facilities in the room and I love my caffeine fix in the morning. That's a first for me in the 9 years we have been travelling in and out of Singapore. As for location, it was not the first time we have stayed on Havelock Road so we knew it would not be in the thick of things and we both enjoy walking so that's not a problem for us. We would definitley stay here again and recommend it to others who don't mind not being too central.

Reviews.Title: “Copthorne Kings Surprise”
Reviews.Author: AntheaCapeTown
Reviews.Content: We were a bit apprehensive about our stay after reading the previous reports. We stayed for 2 nights on our way to Thailand. We arrived at the hotel at 6:30am and the friendly reception staff let us check in early. We had booked 3 double rooms which were comfortable and with their own balconies. We found the hotels location no problem - close to the bus stop which was very reasonable. Over all we found the hotel good value for money. We never had any meals there though. Singapore is beautiful and can't wait to go back again. Did the hop on hop off bus tour - worth it. The zoo with breakfast is a must. The botanital gardens are beautiful. Sentosa Island must be avoided at all costs if you are going over the week-end. We went on Sat afternoon and we had to miss half of our organised tour because it was just too busy. Long queues (and I mean really long queues with lots of pushing and shoving) for everyhing - from getting onto the buses on the island to getting into the various venues. And this after booking an organised tour.

Reviews.Title: “FIne but a little isolated”
Reviews.Author: damilster
Reviews.Content: The Copthorne King's is a rather faded 1960's hotel in an out of the way part of Singapore's centre. The rooms were perfectly fine but if you stay at the rear of the hotel the giant air-conditioning plant is very noisy. My biggest problem was that the website I booked it through claimed that it had a regular shuttle bus to Orchard road (and by default the rest of Singapore via the Metro system), however, the 'regular' shuttle bus only went 4 times a day at fairly bizarre times. No problem the website said it was 200 metres to the metro. That was patently untrue, it was about a mile away which under normal conditions is not a problem but in equatorial heat andmonsoon rain is a bit of a problem. There are better options in SIngapore.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!!!”
Reviews.Author: eil2007
Reviews.Content: I have travelled to many countries and stayed in lots of hotels and this definitely rates this as thee, singularly most disappointing. We paid a lot of money for this holiday (1000s) and had booked through Hayes and Jarvis. On arrival, the girl at reception, whom I can almost describe as hostile kept referring to us as expedia customers, which appears to be a great disadvantage when it comes to room allocation. I tried to communicate that we were not expedia customers but had booked through a reputable agent. Our room which was in the tower block of the hotel which is circular was very small, (don't bring your cat you won't be able to swing it) and the strangest shape. The door opened onto the bed almost. There was an unpleasant smell in that room throughout our stay there. The decor was like something from the 70s or 80s; brown, brown, brown! And I am sure that is when it dated from. The TV was also really dated. One day our room was not cleaned or made up at all and when we complained about this we had to vacate it, after a long day walking around the city, to let them do this. The pool area is located next to the kitchen so all you can smell when lying there is grease from the kitchen funnels. I can honestly say this ghastly accommodation almost ruined our stay in Singapore!

Reviews.Title: “not as good as it should be!”
Reviews.Author: ancientoldbag
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights on the way back from Australia. Despite having requested a non smoking, double room when making the booking 4 months ago, we were offered a twin room & the smell of smoke on opening the door was overwhelming. We requested a different room and were then given a double, non smoking with balcony overlooking the pool. Although this was a deluxe room, the carpet was quite soiled and the fridge on its last legs. Towels had only been provided for one person but since it was 02:00 am we made do. The next day we left the hotel about 09:30 and returned at 15:00 hrs, the room had not been serviced so still no towels. After requesting the room be cleaned & towels provided we went to the pool. We returned to the room at 17:00 hrs & it had still not been cleaned. A further request resulted in an offer of complementary drinks in the Club lounge while the room was cleaned, it was 18:45 before the room was ready. The following day was similar, on returning to the hotel at 15:30 it had not been serviced and again we had to make several requests before anything happened. Later in the evening I ordered ice from room service, it never appeared. Allocating the correct room & providing an efficient cleaning service & room service are the very basic requirements of a hotel & they failed to deliver on this occasion.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly and No problems”
Reviews.Author: tates1
Reviews.Content: Also can't understand negative reviews - were upgraded from Superior to Deluxe room because there were no superior rooms available. Good size room with balcony. Pool was well used by many of the guests. Concierge very helpful. Check-in and out was hassle free with very friendly staff. Used 1 of the restaurants and service and food were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: halder
Reviews.Content: I'm a bit surprised by the negative reviews on here - unless parts of the hotel are still being renovated. I stayed in the tower part which was very good - air conditioning was excellent which in Singapore is a must. The rooms are quite small (the bathroom especially), but otherwise a decent place to stay for a few days. There was a regular free bus into town, and it's only about 15 mins walk to Clarke Quay (about 30 mins to Orchard Road). Happily stay again, although as ever I do resent having to pay extra for the internet when you pay a fair whack for the room in the first place.

Reviews.Title: “too dirty to be acceptable”
Reviews.Author: martin_austria
Reviews.Content: this place's best times must have been decades ago - room size ok, but carpets and chair simply disgusting and dirty, nothing you'd really like to touch. fridge did not work. not a recommendation even though this might apply for most of singapore's hotels in this price range - nothing to write home about!

Reviews.Title: “Very small rooms in tower!!”
Reviews.Author: SpikeOxfordshire
Reviews.Content: We were placed here as part of a 2 centre Virgin Holidays package coupled with Penang, 3 nights plus 7 nights. The hotel is about half a mile from the main bars and on a very busy road. It looks a little dated from the front, especially when compared to its sister Copthorne Hotel directly across the road. We arrived at 0900 local time after a 12 hr overnight flight and directed to the Club floor for breakfast while our room was made ready as it was far too early to take instant occupancy. The hotel consists of a main building and a taller adjoining tower. They have managed to squeeze 5 rooms onto each floor of the tower resulting in a room that is barely suitable for a single person never mind a couple with 2 large suit cases. The rooms only have the tiniest single wardrobe with 5 hangers not even enough space to unpack anyway. There are also no drawers anywhere resulting in trying to live out of a case wedged between the wall and the bed. If returning, which we wouldn’t, I would insist on a room in the main building. On the plus side, the breakfast, starting at 0530, is outstanding, and runs until 1030. I would not recommend the ‘Connections’ Hotel bar, if the sky high prices don’t quickly drive you out, then the resident 5 piece local band certainly will. We were told by the concierge that our Singapore Airlines Boarding card gave us 50 percent discount on the open top bus tours around the city, this turned out to be false as we embarrassingly told after queuing for some time. Avoid the taxi drivers offering you a drive around town as they will take you via a local jewellery factory where you then subjected to the hard sell, very intimidating. China Town provides, by far, the best deals and quality goods and an excellent place to eat cheaply. I telephoned Raffles Hotel to confirm dress code before going for the compulsive ‘Sling’, they advised me on long trousers and collared shirt but was met by all sorts once we got to the ‘Long Bar’ in the Hotel. You can enter straight from the side entrance and up the stairs and shorts and sandals seemed perfectly acceptable. The Night Safari is an absolute must, especially with the Buffet deal. Very very good value and a perfect highlight to the 3 night stay.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: Kymbilli
Reviews.Content: Firstly I would like to say I am not the sort of person to complain or get mad about things going wrong but this place was a JOKE! At 7 am we arrived at the hotel after being assured we would have a room straight away. We were told by the reception staff that our room had been cancelled by the mysterious "mr knowbody." we had booked for a Superior King non smoking room and we were informed that we could have either the non smoking room with 2 single beds in or a smoking room with one double bed. We opted for the smoking room due to us being a couple and after being reasured that it was well ventilated. We were then informed that this room would not be available until 2pm. So with out offering any facilities or complimentary refreshments for the inconvienence we were left to wonder around singapore at 7am in the morning after a 13 hour flight from manchester.... When we returned to the hotel we found our room was ready. except it had the most disgusting smell of ciggerette smoke. It was infact still hazey from the last guest. Oh yes and you could not swing a hamster let alone a Cat in that room. After several complaints and finger pointing from both Virgin and the Hotel we were offered the room with the two single beds AGAIN. What the hotel failed to grasp was no matter how many times they offered us the wrong room it would never be RIGHT, it would never be what we paid for. Eventually the offered to give us some air fresheners and a deodouriser (which never arrived). Eventually we just gave up complaining. It was a pointless exercise. There is nothing I can say good about this hotel appart from the day we left. DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Weekend Package”
Reviews.Author: Hui P
Reviews.Content: We were checked into a superior room with a river view based on the weekend package offered by the hotel. It even came with 2 inclusive breakfasts. I am quite surprised at the review about small rooms, as the room that we had was spacious & clean. I also enjoyed the facilities like the Jacuzzi Bathtub, Sauna & swimming pool as they were mostly empty when we were using it. Although the breakfast selection was not so fantastic, I have no complaints as it's complimentary. At SGD$200, I feel that it is of a good value as most hotels are priced around that range in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute disaster”
Reviews.Author: The_Ram_Returns
Reviews.Content: We arrived very early in the morning. We were suprised that there was a free room as we would normally expect to get checked in around 2pm. However, despite having this holiday booked over a year in advance, we still managed, despite being on our honeymoon and non smokers, to get a twin smoking room. When I complained we were told they were very busy and would let me know when a king sized non smoking double, which we had requested, was available. The next day I was told we could have a new room. It would be a queen sized smoking room! Absolutely useless. When we complained further we didn't get any joy from anyone. We also dined at the Tien Court restaurant there. The food was nice but when we received the bill I was astonished! There charges are not clearly stated... you have been warned! The hotel as a whole was very clean. The rooms are very basic. By the time we left we were angry and stunk of smoke. I really cannot believe Virgin have this rated as 4 star. This leg of our trip nearly ruined our 1st wedding anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Ok, TINY ROOMS”
Reviews.Author: hello51
Reviews.Content: we went to singapore in May for a week. we were quite disappointed with the size of the standard room which was very small. When I looked on the web-site the standard rooms appear much bigger. There was no balcony and the hairdryer in the bathroom did not work properly. However the rooms were cleaned properly every day and generally a clean hotel. The food in the hotel was very expensive so its much cheaper eating out. There are lots of nice cafe's and restraunts over the river front which is a 2min walk from the hotel. Hotel very close to buss stop and impressive metro service. Good value for money for electrical goods. You'll find that one shop owner will own lots of diferent stalls in different electrical malls especially if your looking to buy laptops. Need to haggle for best buy! Orchard road was very expensive for shopping. Best shopping place for us was Marina Bay!! Affordable. Best exchange rate you can get is in Orchard Road. Mustafa Centre is open 24 hours per day and has everything you need. Little India was great! Lots of variety for food. We will visit singapore again. watch out for cabs which can not stop to pick passengers up from the main road as they will get fined so you need to go to a side road.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Base For A Wonderful City”
Reviews.Author: philr1911
Reviews.Content: We stopped at the Copthorne King's hotel for 3 nights in April and found it to be a lovely hotel and nicely located just beyond Robertsons Quay. The hotel and it's amenities where clean and well presented and evreything you'd expect from a hotel in this class. The staff throughout our stay were friendly and very welcoming. Located a few minutes walk from Robertsons Quay, the hotel benefits from being far enough away from the noise and bustle of, say, Orchard Road whilst Robertson, Clarke and Boat Quay were all an easy stroll away. The hotel set the tone for our stay in Singapore - a relaxed and friendly hotel in a relaxed and friendly city.

Reviews.Title: “No more than a stopover”
Reviews.Author: caneable
Reviews.Content: Sorry it's taken me a while to get down to recording my thoughts about this hotel. We stayed here for 2 nights at the end of February on our way out to Australia. We stayed in a room in the main towerblock, which seemed to be the main area for short stay guests. Frankly we were very disappointed. We were told that because we had requested a non-smoking room we could only have twin beds. Then when we reached the room we were amazed at its size. Not only was the space very limited, but the storage area was tiny too. The single wardrobe had no full length hanging space, and there were few drawers. There was nowhere to store cases so one had to be perched on the luggage cradle, causing an obstruction in passage to the bathroom, and the other had to be left on the floor at the end of a bed, filling the longest wallspace! As mentioned in another review, the bath is hilariously small, in fact I reckon it's an assault course shower cubicle! Away from the accommodation,our package included breakfast. It was OK, but I would not have chosen to eat there had I needed to pay, as it didn't represent good value for money in my opinion. The staff were very good. They were efficient, polite and obliging to most requests. A request to change the down pillow cases and quilts was dealt with in minutes, and the front desk staff were very happy to arrange a late checkout and changing facilities as we had an evening departure. It is a distance from the city centre, but the taxi to Orchard Rd is quite cheapand the walk to Clark'e Quay should not be a cause for complaint for anyone of reasonable health! We found it most pleasant. We booked a City tour through the hotel's website and, within the usual constraints of such tours, was very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Quality hotel near the river but a little far from the city centre”
Reviews.Author: HattieC
Reviews.Content: We stayed twice at this hotel as we had two stopovers in Singapore. On both occasions, on arrival we were told that our choice of room was not available, but were upgraded free of charge. The corner room in the tower section was great - very large, with a fantastic view of the river and had an enormous bathroom. Although it was a smoking room, someone was sent up with a machine to freshen the room up which worked fine. The second room was in the main wing, and although it was smaller and did not have a good view, the decor was better - fresh and clean, and looked recently decorated. The Pekanese buffet at the hotel was quite pricey, but was always full and apparently offers really good food, a claim backed up by the constant crowds of people eating there. Overall, I would recommend the hotel - staff were friendly and helpful, and our stay was trouble-free. My one complaint would be that the location is a little inconvenient. It's close to the river and a 10-15 minute walk from Clarke Quay, but much further to walk anywhere else. Chinatown can be reached in under half an hour, but you'd need to take a bus (cheap, regular) or taxi to Little India, Orchard Road etc.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel - TINY Rooms”
Reviews.Author: RLMUK
Reviews.Content: We checked into this hotel for the last night of our honeymoon en route from Thailand back to London. The Lobby is that of a typical business hotel, nothing too impressive and Reception were helpful enough... We asked at reception whether they had a double bed available; however she informed us that they only had rooms with 2 single beds available. Then we got to the room.... I would not recommend booking a standard room at this hotel because as we discovered, the standard rooms are located in a dingy wing and are very, i mean VERY small rooms. and the bathtub looked as if it was cut in half, you could not even sit down in it, it was the most ridiculous thing i have ever seen. We went down to reception to change rooms and they gave us keys to have a look at another room... what do you know it had a double bed! but again it was very small. We eneded up paying 150 SGD to upgrade to an executive room because we just couldnt stay in a room so small. Please understand i am not exaggerating, the room was very very claustrophobic there was almost literally no room to move around. The only bonus for this hotel is its location. It is located close to the harbour and a 10 minutes walk to Clarke Quay, which has a brilliant night life and great restaurants and bars. I would not stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Rude Front Office”
Reviews.Author: luv2ravel
Reviews.Content: Welcomed by unfriendly lady on the front desk, get to our room, guess what? Dirty & used (uncleaned) room. Call the front desk, no one came, so we had to go down again, speak to the same lady. I know it's not her mistake personally but she didn't even apologize on behalf of the hotel, instead she's defending herself by saying "It says cleaned & ready on the computer" Oh my GOD, what a service?!?! The new room given is so tiny but anyway... the rest of the staff are fine, except that one lady who shouldn't work in the hospitality industry at all. The area of the hotel is not central either, I used taxi most time there, it's very cheap (compare to London taxi).

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: hydepark
Reviews.Content: After reading the most recent reviews of the Copthorne King's, I had very low expectations for my stay during the Easter break. Service was much better than I expected, everyone spoke to me in a courteous and professional manner. There was a number of minor irritations but I was able to brush them off as I had plenty of positive experiences during my stay. For example, after settling into my room on the 17th floor in the Tower Wing, I discovered an ashtray. I don't believe I specified a nonsmoking room when I made the reservation or was given a choice. There was a strong smell of perfume while the fan was on, and when it was off, a smell of smoke was noticeable. I liked the room, an odd-shaped room with a nice view of the Furama hotel next door as well as a garden below. I had the fan on most of the time, and that seemed to blank out the smell of smoke so I didn't ask for a room change. The bathroom didn't have a normal-size bathtub but a half-tub with the back elevated so you could sit on it. It would have been nice to lie in the bathtub but the half-tub was not too bad. I ordered room service for breakfast, filling in the order and putting it outside the door before 3 am. The order was delivered on time but one egg was missing. I only discovered this after the waiter had gone. I didn't have to specify I wanted 2 eggs since that was what was on the menu. The hotel's location is not as inconvenient as some have suggested. It is a short walk to Great World City, which is a nice mall with plenty of shops and restaurants. It is right next to the Miramar hotel, which is a stop on the Hippotours. And it is across from Saiboo Street, where you can access the river leading to Clarke Quay. I booked the hotel a month ago and got a US99 rate on Expedia for Friday to Sunday. This was my first time at the Copthorne and at a hotel in the Havelock Road area, so I wasn't expecting much. There were plenty of instances when I had to contact the hotel about something, and each instance was promptly resolved to my satisfaction. There were more positives than negatives from this experience and I would certainly consider staying at the Copthorne King's again.

Reviews.Title: “Find another hotel”
Reviews.Author: MARSHALLFAMILY_8
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hotel as part of a ten day trip the first seven nights being in Penang Malaysia. After a wonderful seven nights we were greated at the Copthorne Kings by the most unhelpful and sore face receptionist it has been our misfortune to meet her name was RUTH. She took our passports and our booking voucher fron Virgin Holidays, then proceeded after a five minute silence to tell us we would have to give credit details as we were not booked in and if they couldnt contact Virgin we would have to pay the bill and sort it out ourselves on return to the UK. We were then told that they were busy and that they had no rooms. When my husband started to get mad she managed to find us a room on the twelth floor, so small that we could not get into it with two full size suitcases, you couldnt unpack if you had wanted to given the the one wardrobe was almost compleatly filled with a safe. The bathroom was so small only one person would be able to go in at a time and the bath was big enough for a four year old child to sit in! At this point my husband got the Virgin brochure out and went back to reception with it. On production of this and the photo of the standard room that we had booked they amazingly had another room on the fourth floor. This had two single beds but at least it was a room with a real bathroom. The balcony lead out to the pool which was ok but the noise from the huge generator just outside was constant and would affect all the rooms on that side. We should also have received a basket of fruit on arrival and a late check out of our room as part of the Virgin flagship deal we got neither of these, by this time we couldnt be bothered fighting for them and just put it down to poor service and we would most deffonatly not recomend this hotel and shall also be writing to Virgin regarding them aswell. Just to finish although our room was not available for the free late checkout we could have kept it at a cost of 80 singapore dollars plus tax. There are at least six other hotels in this area choose another.

Reviews.Title: “Chinese New Year Blues”
Reviews.Author: KevinSingapore
Reviews.Content: Booked a 1 night stay through wotif.com for 8th Feb (Chinese New Year - 2nd Day). Hotel room was comfortable. Amenities in the room was better than average. All amenities in working order. Room service was prompt. Hotel staff at lobby was quite dead though. No greetings or well wishes for CNY. They didn't make us feel warm or welcomed but that's ok, we didn't get the room for their company anyway. They were probably tired or pissed cos they had to work during CNY. Bellhop offered help to carry bag. Ample carparking space. All in all, it was a decent stay. They could however improve on PR to better their international standing with other hotel staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great stopover”
Reviews.Author: BlackpoolWillow
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Copthorne for just one night on returning to the UK. The location is excellent, just five minutes from Clarke Quay and restaurants. I have no complaints at all about this hotel, the staff went out of their way to accommodate our needs, baggage storage, rooms for changing, breakfasts they could not have been more helpful. The hotel has everything you need, very clean, courteous staff, good restaurant and bars. A special mention to the reception team at this hotel (we had bad experiences at the Orchard Hotel on the way out) they really were superb.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location-Better Service”
Reviews.Author: KatySpinach
Reviews.Content: This hotel was such a good choice for myself and my family. We were on our way back from Oz and chose to spend a week in Singapore. The shuttle bus from the hotel to Orchard Road meant that we didn't have to worry about taxi's or staying nearer the main shopping area (which is very very noisy). The food at the hotel is award winning and with good reason. The buffet is like nothing you've ever seen! They cater for western palates but it is generally chinese fair. Great quality and even better service. The smaller bistro style eating area was also good quality and I really enjoyed the more European cuisine. The rooms were clean, quiet and were comfortable and spacious. Copthorne Kings is one of Singapore's best hotels and retains a friendly vibe to boot!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nicko1London
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights whilst on a 10 day trip around asia. Great Hotel,excellent location,staff helpful and efficent,asked for a late checkout which they were happy to help with.First Class.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel! It was great!”
Reviews.Author: travelnow08
Reviews.Content: Great hotel I booked it through flight centre. They upgraded my room. Excellent facilities, good food, extremely clean, great value for money only $177 AUD a nite on a weekend. Great staff, great service. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a Stop over”
Reviews.Author: Shejohn
Reviews.Content: We had a somewhat small room in the “tower” section of the hotel, which I think is mainly used by stopover passengers en route to Australia. The staff were friendly and helpful and the hotel was very clean and welcoming. Wardrobe space was somewhat limited after luggage storage and the small sit in bath required careful negotiation in order to stand in a flat area for a shower. The room although small was pleasant enough but the lighting was very poor and I found it very difficult to read standard size font (such as 11 of 12 point) after it had got dark.

Reviews.Title: “5* treatment”
Reviews.Author: Pettrish
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in October 07 and from the moment we checked in we were given 5* treatment. The staff were so helpful and polite, they were only too pleased to be asked about where to go and what to see, and the consierge was very knowledgable. The hotel laundry was very efficient and the swimming pool lovely and clean. The room was fully equiped and when we ran out of tea and coffee this was replenished immediately. the whole place was clean and comfortable and we will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Second Stay - Still Good!”
Reviews.Author: msbianca2
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at this Copthorne. I am always happy with the facility. My room this time around was MUCH larger than my last stay (see my old pics). The front desk manager Ramesh was very accommodating to our schedule. The breakfast as usual was good and plentiful. The location of the hotel is just o.k. – it's not exactly in the middle of attractions. The hotel does offer a free shuttle to Orchard road and to another major street. We were able to catch the subway from the Orchard area to get around. You have to reserve a shuttle spot and it’s on a first come first serve basis. There is a city bus that runs in front, which helps cut down on cost. I will definitely stay here again with no hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Super 'Suite' Stay”
Reviews.Author: suitejoe
Reviews.Content: Great suite rooms. Spacious and well designed rooms and living with quality furnishing. Both room and living comes with balcony. Living room comes with a dvd player and 37' wall mounted LCD. Bonus, bathroom long bath is a jacuzzi bathtub! Bed was comfortable and comes with a list of pillow selections. Can also request for the quilted mattress pad for that added comfort. Definitely a great hotel with fantastic location. Near the Tiong Bahru food market with plenty of award winning hawker food. And minutes to orchard and walking distance to ZOUK, a hip club. Great hotel restaurant that serves superb penang food at the Princess terrace and exquisite Chinese food at Tien Court.

Reviews.Title: “Good all rounder”
Reviews.Author: Tigs_on_tour
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a number of weeks on a business trip and, on balance, I would recommend this hotel. Location wise, the hotel is well placed. Chinatown is a relatively short walk (even shorter taxi ride) although you won't walk anywhere quickly in the humid day time. Orchard Rd is also a walk away, although I would recommend using the hotel shuttle bus as, again, the humidity can be insufferable at times. You can also walk along the river towards Clark Quay where you can take boat trips. There are always taxis outside the hotel and they are inexpensive. Getting one back, however, may be more of a challenge - especially in the rush hour. My room was a very comfortable double with quite possibly the most comfortable bed I have ever slept it. There was a small fridge with Tiger beer and a few other snacks and drinks which, although expensive by Singapore standards, seemed quite cheap compared to a British hotel's prices. The TV didn't always have the best reception but there was a wide variety of channels broadcasting in English and usually I could find something reasonable to watch when channel hopping before going to sleep. There was also very reasonable storage space, lighting and mirrors. The room did feature a balcony, but it was usually too hot and humid to stay out there at all during the day, so really it's just an aesthetic feature. My room faced out to the back of the hotel which was fine for me on a high floor, but not so good for those lower down as the air con units outside were incredibly noisy. Other members of my party were facing out of the front which apparently suffered from traffic noise. The bathroom was prefectly acceptable with a good powerful shower over a bath tub. My only quibble with my room was that the carpet suffered from patches of condensation from the air con. I didn't bother raising this with housekeeping as I really didn't want to end up in a room nearer the aircon units or facing out front. Breakfast featured a very good variety of food from many different nations and you'd have been hard pushed not to find something you liked. The pancakes, made to order, were a real hit with our party, the chicken sausages were not. The coffee was extremely bitter but the tea was a superb brew. Breakfast was presided over by a rather matronly member of staff on the door who eyed up everyone as if they were blagging their way in. I didn't try any of the other restaurants, other than the cafe in the foyer when I wanted something quickly. To be honest there are so many superb places to eat in Singapore that are so much cheaper that you'd be mad to waste your money in a hotel restaurant other than for breakfast. There is a hotel shop but I would advise checking first for items in the shop attached to the petrol station next door (to the right of the hotel as you face out). Their prices are much, much lower. Bottles of water, for example, were a fraction of the price of the hotel shop ones. There's also a very reasonable shopping mall, complete with supermarket, just a 5 - 10 min walk away. Get directions from reception as you'd be unlikely to happen across it otherwise. The hotel has a pool, although it is pretty small. If you fancy a larger pool you can take a taxi very cheaply to The Delta Swimming Complex which has 3 large pools, one of them a dedicated children's pool, and costs very little - something like the equivalent of 60p. It only takes 5 or 10 mins in a taxi. One feature of the hotel which really appealed to us (being there for a few weeks) was the hotel's launderette for guest use. This was inexpensive and powder was provided - bargain! Makes a change from washing your clothes in the bath or having to use pricey laundry services. We initially used the hotel bar quite a lot in the evening but found the service slow, indeed sometimes reluctant. We eventually started going to a bar over the road by the river where the service was superior. There were good business facilities and we were on a deal which included broadband access in our rooms. However, if your deal does not include this it is pretty expensive and you would be better off taking your laptop to one of the many bars in town which offer access to customers. Please note, they take a tough line on people "piggybacking" onto other's internet access in Singapore - so make sure you use it legitimately. Generally speaking I was happy with this hotel and found the staff to be extremely helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all...”
Reviews.Author: Rita07
Reviews.Content: This hotel was good. The rooms were clean and well-designed. They were small, but not overly tiny. The bed was rock-hard. People not accustomed to sleeping on a bed like this will probably wake up stiff the next morning! The bathrooms were nice and spacious. Also, the windows let in a lot of sunlight! The front desk is not overly friendly, but they were efficient and helpful. They got the job done. The bellmen were all extremely helpful and friendly. It is very easy to get a taxi by just walking out the front door, or by letting the bell captain know you need one. I thought this was very convenient. The closest MRT stop, Outram Park, is about a 25 minute walk from the hotel. It's just easier to take a cab. The pool on the third floor is really nice. There is also a hot tub and steam room, but both were not working at the time. There are three restaurants: one is a buffet (which was perpetually busy), one was a Chinese restaurant, and one was an extremely overpriced lobby restaurant serving "western" food. All in all, I had a nice stay here. I think this is classified as a three-star hotel, and people need to keep that in mind when writing reviews.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: Milonotovaltine
Reviews.Content: Staff were efficient but not warm and cheerful. The hotel is located in a good part of Singapore. Liked the modern design and cleanliness. Disliked the mini bathtub and uneven floor, made it very difficult to shower, bumped my elbow on the wall. Didn't look clean enough to bathe in. The room was tiny but well designed. The bed was very hard, I expected a hotel like this to use a plush mattress instead of very firm. But luckily the pillows and quilt were very comfy. Bathroom amenities were good, got toothbrush and body lotion. Weird shaped hair dryer that could induce one's imagination. There was a problem with the internet cable but was fixed accordingly. The internet charge was too expensive, 50 cents per minute. Called the front desk but not answered. No tea bags, snacks or electric kettle. No alarm clock. Carpet was clean. The opening and shutting of the connecting door outside drove me crazy. No Cinemax/HBO/Pay per movie. The armchair was not comfy, no headrest nor footrest. Good bathrobe. Overall, it's a good hotel, I will recommend it. But personally I won't stay here again as I don't like hard mattress and I want a movie channel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stop Over Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vincec
Reviews.Content: This hotel, alittle way from the city centre is a good spot for that two or three day stopover on the way to or from the UK /Austrailia. We found the staff helpful paricularly the Bell Captain. Unlike some otheres we had no problems with the room albeit in a superior grade room. Don't miss the swimming pool a little luxury used by few people, The hotel has a free bus to downtown which runs fairly frequently. However as metered taxis in this city are so cheap transport is really easy and affordable. In summary a good stopover hotel particularly if you can get it at a reasonable price

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: iloveorlando
Reviews.Content: We had enjoyed a 2 night stay in Singapore and this hotel was part of our package tour. We arrived early in the morning after a 13hr flight and were pleasantly surprised by the hotel - it exceeded our expectations. We were lucky to be allocated a room after a short wait - usually check-in is after 2pm. The 'first' room we were allocated had a double bed and a 'day bed'. It was nice and clean with a balcony with good views across the city. We asked for the bed to be made up for our 12yr old and went out to do some sight-seeing. Upon returning late in the evening, the 3rd bed was still not made up and after several calls to Reception, they admitted that they had given us the wrong room for 3 people, but would send up a roll-out bed (removing the day bed). As it was late and we were tired, we requested that we change room instead of having to move furniture around - they obliged and we went next door which was a 'family' room with 2 doubles. The room allocation error was our only glitch and the new room was very nice, clean and the beds lovely and comfy. Although we faced the front of the hotel, the rooms were very quiet and we heard no traffic noise at all. The hotel offers a buffet breakfast which we had the following morning. There was good array of breakfast fare including Asian and American style food. We opted to take the cheap and plentiful taxis out and about which worked for us. Although we did not eat main meals in the hotel, it offered a retaurant, bar (will live music) coffee shop, pool, gym etc. The Copthorne Kings in our opinion, is a clean well maintained hotel ideal for a short stay. It is a little out of the way, but taxis/transportation is cheap. If we were staying longer, I would have opted for a more central hotel. Overall, we had a pleasant stay and would recommend this hotel for a short stay in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: 6800christine
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Singapore and was very undecided which was the best area to stay. We decided upon this hotel and I think we chose well. The rooms are small and the bed a little hard but these are the only drawbacks. The location was great. Just a short walk to Clarke Quay where all the bars alongside the river are lit up at night. Try Brewerkz on the Quay where they brew on the premesis,this is reasonably priced.We would recommend this hotel and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “good for price”
Reviews.Author: anniedaventryEngland
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights on way to Bali. Had already read other reviews before went and they were spot on. Nice clean hotel, nice revamped lobby. Staff were friendly. But as mentioned the rooms are very small and the beds were very hard. As I have back problems one night I had to get my husband to sleep in the single bed with me so I could pinch his duvet to lie on! The bathroom was clean but small too. We had the pool to ourselves and never saw anyone else use it which seemed a shame. The other problem which has previously been mentioned is its location. You are within walking distance of chinatown, so you can get to the MRT easy enough but its coming back. Its very very humid so by the time we left we were so glad to walk up the steps of the road bridge for the last time! The MRT IS 1000 times superior to the london underground. Its cheap, clean and fast. You never feel unsafe where ever you are. Taxis are cheap but you cant get one during rush hour and when we came from Sentosa island a taxi told us once in it was a fixed price. The price was about ten times more so we got out! Go for the metered ones. Its a good medium class hotel but only worth a few days stop. I would not have been happy to spend more time here. Even though we had a good view the room was to cramped and the beds too firm. Be warned if you go to Raffles and have a singapore sling they work out at about £12 each. its vastly over rated.
